result.execSummary:
The defendant Mickolous Terrell Turner was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Mickolous Terrell Turner in court with attorney Charles Robert Roozen.  Defendant Mickolous Terrell Turner in custody.  William G. Davidson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: LM  
Case in court for plea and sentencing hearing, case back on the record at 11:03am. Parties have reached a resolution. State placed negotiations on the record. Defense counsel and defendant confirms. State advised the Court they have complied with the Victims' Rights Law.

Plea hearing held

AS TO COUNT 1:
Defendant changes plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea, court advised the defendant of Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if he is not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived their rights.   Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum and Jury Instruction/Elements of the offense, received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.   
Court ordered a DNA sample and advised defendant of applicable surcharge.

AS TO COUNT 2:
Pursuant to negotiations and on the Motion of the State, Court Ordered COUNT 2 DISMISSED BUT READ IN for the purpose of sentencing.

Sentencing proceeded.   Statements made as to sentencing.   

Court ordered defendant to serve 70 days in the House of Correction, Concurrent, with 70 days credit for time served.  TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

Court ordered applicable costs, fees and surcharges to be paid by 11-06-2017.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank - surcharge IMPOSED.
Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.

Filed:
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit

Defendant Mickolous Terrell Turner in court with attorney Charles Robert Roozen.  Defendant Mickolous Terrell Turner in custody.  Andrea Lynn Fendry appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: LM  
Case in court for plea/sentencing hearing, however defense requests more time, no objection from state.  Case remains calendared in Branch 07.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 5, 2017 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Charles Robert Roozen in court, defendant Mickolous Terrell Turner not in court, in custody.  William G. Davidson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense requested plea/sentencing date.  All parties are notified effective July 29, 2017 this case will be assigned to Judge Thomas J. McAdams, Branch 7, in Room 515 of the Courthouse.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 2, 2017 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Mickolous Terrell Turner in court with attorney Zoe Plovanich.  Defendant Mickolous Terrell Turner in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
DUPLICATE FILE IN COURT.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Havas, Branch 10.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 10, 2017 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services discharge summary received and filed.
Notice of bond forfeiture mailed to defendant; Original in file. ($250.00 signature bond) gj
Signature bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 250.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.

Attorney Terese M. Dick in court.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Case scheduled for plea and sentencing.  Defendant failing to appear.  On State's motion, the court ordered a bench warrant to issue, any bond forfeited and Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification by the Clerk of Circuit Court.

Defendant Mickolous Terrell Turner in court with attorney Terese M. Dick.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Case scheduled for plea and sentencing hearing.  Defense requests additional time to review discovery with defendant.  Court orders case adjourned to Branch 45.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 23, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Mickolous Terrell Turner in court with attorney Terese M. Dick.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
State has turned over an offer and discovery.  Defense requests a plea and sentencing date. Court orders case adjourned to branch 45.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.
Court ordered defendant to be monitored by Drug Testing
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription

Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  
Defendant to have no contact with: JCPenney  Dept Store Milwaukee County.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Mickolous Terrell Turner in court with attorney Terese M. Dick.  Defendant Mickolous Terrell Turner in custody.  
Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.     Deputy Court Clerk:  sm

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Michelle Ackerman Havas, Branch 45.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  
Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.

Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Mickolous Terrell Turner not in court.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued.  Court ordered any bail posted to be forfeited.  State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from the Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court.  Court makes finding that there is a possible victim identified, therefore, Court stays order of forfeiture with recompense to be determined at close of case.vb
SUMMONS MAILED. DEFENDANT ORDERED INTO ROOM 221 SAFETY BUILDING ON 9/9/15 @ 1:30 pm
